sen.j: 織田 信則（おだ のぶのり、慶長4年（1599年） - 寛永7年1月2日 (旧暦)（1630年2月13日））は、江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Nobunori ODA (1599 - February 13, 1630) was a Japanese feudal lord in the Edo period.
Nobunori ODA (1599 - February 13, 1630) was daimyo (a Japanese feudal lord) who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュ結果を参照し、"who lived during"としました。
sen.e: Nobunori ODA (1599 - February 13, 1630) was daimyo (a Japanese feudal lord) who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 丹波国丹波柏原藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: He was the second lord of the Tanba-Kaibara Domain in Tanba Province.
He was the second lord of the Tanba-Kaibara clan in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 用語リストの指示に従い、変更しました。
sen.e: He was the second lord of the Tanba-Kaibara clan in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 初代藩主・織田信包の三男で、織田信長の甥に当たる。
sen.e: He was the third son of the first domain lord Nobukane ODA and a nephew of Nobunaga ODA.
He was the third son of Nobukane ODA, the first lord, and a nephew of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: "Nobukane ODA"の前後にカンマを付けました。
sen.e: He was the third son of Nobukane ODA, the first lord, and a nephew of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は従四位下侍従、式部少輔、刑部大輔。
sen.e: His court rank and posts were Jushiinoge jiju (Chamberlain with Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice).

After holding the office of chamberlain and rising to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), he also held the offices of Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice).
sen.cmt: 用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました。侍従→chamberlain[作業指示一式内の"Dos and Don'ts for the Kyoto Project"の第3項目、Be careful not to "romanize" Japanese terms unnecessarily、に従い、表記を変更しました]
sen.e: After holding the office of chamberlain and rising to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), he also held the offices of Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and Gyobu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Justice).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1614, he succeeded his father who died.
In 1614, he succeeded to the lord due to the death of his father.
sen.cmt: succeed の後に「人」が来る場合は、as the lord of the domain などの役職等がきます。これに従い英訳しますと、he succeeded his father as the lord of the domain due to the death of his father となり、"his father"が2回出てくるので、簡潔にするため、変更しました。
sen.e: In 1614, he succeeded to the lord due to the death of his father.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 遺領の相続にあたって、兄織田信重から異論が出されるものの、幕府によって退けられた。
sen.e: His brother Nobushige ODA expressed objection to his inheritance of the property, but it was rejected by the bakufu.
Although his older brother, Nobushige ODA, expressed an objection to property inheritance by Nobunori, the objection was rejected by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 兄→older brother[用語リストの指示に従い、変更しました]Nobushige ODAの前後にカンマを付けました。"objection" は可算名詞なので、"an"を付けました。
sen.e: Although his older brother, Nobushige ODA, expressed an objection to property inheritance by Nobunori, the objection was rejected by the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元和 (日本)2年（1616年）10月25日、従五位下侍従に叙任する。
sen.e: He was appointed to Jugoige jiju (Chamberlain with Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on October 25, 1616.
On December 3, 1616, he was conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 元和 (日本)2年（1616年）10月25日→December 3, 1616[こよみのページを検索し、新暦表記に変更しました]従五位下侍従に叙任→conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain[侍従の職は変わらないので、用語集を参照し、表現を変更しました]
sen.e: On December 3, 1616, he was conferred to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後に従四位下侍従に昇進した。
sen.e: Then, he was promoted to Jushiige jiju (Chamberlain with Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
Thereafter, he was promoted to the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 従四位下侍従に叙任→conferred to the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain[侍従の職は変わらないので、用語集を参照し、表現を変更しました]
sen.e: Thereafter, he was promoted to the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) as a chamberlain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元和6年（1620年）1月18日、大坂城の修築工事を命じられる。
sen.e: He was assigned to renovate the Osaka-jo Castle on January 18, 1620.
On February 21, 1620, he was ordered to renovate Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 元和6年（1620年）1月18日→February 21, 1620[こよみのページを検索し、新暦表記に変更しました]
sen.e: On February 21, 1620, he was ordered to renovate Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寛永3年（1626年）、徳川家光の上洛に付き従った。
sen.e: In 1626, he accompanied Iemitsu TOKUGAWA to Kyoto.
In 1626, he accompanied Iemitsu TOKUGAWA on his visit to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 上洛→a visit to Kyoto["to Kyoto"のみでは、説明不足と判断し、a visit を付け足しました]
sen.e: In 1626, he accompanied Iemitsu TOKUGAWA on his visit to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寛永7年（1630年）正月2日、32歳で死去した。
sen.e: He died at the age of 32 on January 2, 1630.
On February 13, 1630, he died at the age of 32.
sen.cmt: 寛永7年（1630年）正月2日→February 13, 1630[新暦に変更しました。上記、没年月日にも1630年2月13日と記載されております]
sen.e: On February 13, 1630, he died at the age of 32.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His hogo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Yogan Tokuko Keishoin (陽岩徳公恵照院).
sen.cmt: 「陽岩徳公恵照院」の読み不明
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: 陽岩徳公恵照院 (pronunciation unknown)
sen.cmt: 下記では、"Graveyard: Shosen-ji Temple ～"と、コロンで表記しているので、同様の表記に変更しました。法号「陽岩徳公恵照院」が読み方不明でしたので、(pronunciation unknown) を追記しました。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: 陽岩徳公恵照院
sen.cmt: (pronunciation unknown)を削除しました。陽岩徳公恵照院 は読み方不明です。

sen.j: 墓所：東京都渋谷区恵比寿南の松泉寺。
sen.e: Graveyard: The Shosen-ji Temple in Ebisu Minami, Shibuya Ward, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 松泉寺 （しょうせんじ）<http://www.e-ishiya.com/tera-ichiran/shibuyaku/tendai-rinzai.html>
sen.e: Graveyard: Shosen-ji Temple in Ebisu Minami, Shibuya Ward, Tokyo
sen.cmt: "The"と文尾のピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Graveyard: Shosen-ji Temple in Ebisu Minami, Shibuya Ward, Tokyo
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Nagamori OKABE.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Nagamori OKABE.
sen.cmt: 娘→the daughter[用語リストのレビュー結果を参照し、変更しました]
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Nagamori OKABE.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 織田信勝、娘（植村家貞室）、娘（石河貞利室）の一男二女あり。
sen.e: He had a son Nobukatsu ODA, and two daughters, Iesada UEMURA's wife and Sadatoshi (貞利) ISHIKAWA's wife.
sen.cmt: 植村家貞（うえむらいえさだ）<http://members2.jcom.home.ne.jp/sengokubusyou/uemurasisyou.html>「石河貞利」の読み不明
sen.e: He had one son, Nobukatsu ODA, and two daughters (Iesada UEMURA's wife and Sadatoshi ISHIKAWA's wife).
sen.cmt: 「植村家貞室」と「石河貞利室」はカッコで括られていたので、カッコで括り、英訳も変更しました]
sen.e: He had one son, Nobukatsu ODA, and two daughters (Iesada UEMURA's wife and Sadatoshi ISHIKAWA's wife).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
